title: Watch Method for Direction Finding (Northern Hemisphere)
brief: Use an analog watch and the sun to determine north-south direction in the northern hemisphere.
steps: Step 1: Hold the watch horizontal and point the hour hand directly at the sun.
Step 2: Find the angle between the hour hand and the 12 o'clock mark.
Step 3: Bisect this angle (find the midpoint) to get the north-south line.
Step 4: Remember the sun is in the east before noon and west after noon to identify which end is north.
Step 5: If on daylight savings time, use the midpoint between hour hand and 1 o'clock instead.
warnings: Accuracy decreases closer to the equator.
Must use true local time, not daylight savings time for best accuracy.
Only works with analog watches - draw a clock face if you only have digital.
